metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12827 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in res_pjsip_messaging in Digium Asterisk versions 13.21-cert3, 13.27.0, 15.7.2, 16.4.0 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to crash Asterisk by sending a specially crafted SIP MESSAGE message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-12827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-config - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-modules - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-tests - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2').
